channel.title: UEFA.com - News
channel.description: All news about European football. Generic news, match previews, match reports and much more.

item.title: Substitute Patson sends Salzburg into final
item.description:
Barcelona 1-2 Salzburg
Trailing until just after the hour, Salzburg hit back to book their place in Monday's UEFA Youth League final, Daka Patson scoring the winner late on.

item.title: Real Madrid v Atlético: past meetings, stats and reaction
item.description: Real Madrid have beaten Atlético in each of the past three seasons, but revenge won't be the Rojiblancos' only incentive this time round. "Hopefully we can give the Vicente Calderón the goodbye it deserves."

item.title: #UEL semi-final draw: Ajax v Lyon, Celta v Man. United
item.description: Celta Vigo and Manchester United will meet for the first time in this season's UEFA Europa League semi-finals, with Ajax and Lyon drawn against each other in the other tie.

item.title: UEFA Champions League semi-final form guide
item.description: Real Madrid are in a record seventh successive semi-final while Monaco have not featured since 2004 – how have the remaining sides fared in their previous European Cup last-four ties?

item.title: Semi-finalists go head to head
item.description: UEFA.com looks in the record books to see how the semi-finalists' previous meetings played out, and finds history is on the side of Real Madrid and Juventus.

item.title: #UCL semi-final draw: Madrid v Atlético, Monaco v Juve
item.description: Last season's finalists Real Madrid and Atlético Madrid will face each other in the semi-finals – the fourth season in a row they meet in this competition – with Monaco taking on Juventus in the other tie.

item.title: Carli Lloyd on Manchester City v Lyon
item.description: Manchester City's European debut season moves up a notch when they welcome holders Lyon, and Carli Lloyd spoke to UEFA.com about the tie and their continental bow.

item.title: Røddik Hansen on life at Barcelona
item.description: Denmark defender Line Røddik Hansen is aiming to help Barcelona to their first UEFA Women's Champions League final, and she spoke to UEFA.com about life as a professional at the club.

item.title: Thursday round-up: how the last four qualified
item.description: Lyon reached the semi-finals after beating Beşiktaş on penalties, with Ajax and Manchester United needing extra time to book their progress. It was comparatively simple for Celta Vigo.

item.title: Who are the UEFA Europa League semi-finalists?
item.description: A one-time winner and three semi-final debutants – including a club in the hunt for their last missing European trophy – are in the mix; meet the four teams still standing in the UEFA Europa League.

item.title: UEFA Europa League draw: potential match-ups
item.description: UEFA.com runs through the last four teams standing in the UEFA Europa League, taking a closer look at their form and head-to-head records against their potential opponents.

item.title: Full guide to the Europa League semi-final draw
item.description: The UEFA Europa League semi-final draw takes place on Friday, but what time does it start, who's going to be involved and how will it work? UEFA.com explains all.

item.title: Guillemenot back 'home' for Youth League finale
item.description: Swiss forward Jeremy Guillemenot will be the focus of attention for the locals when Barcelona play Salzburg in the UEFA Youth League semi-finals in Nyon.

item.title: Women's Champions League semi-final preview
item.description: The semi-final first legs are played on Saturday and we bring you ten things you need to know about each of the ties as Manchester City face Lyon and Barcelona take on Paris Saint-Germain.

item.title: Why Monaco should fear nobody in final four
item.description: As swashbuckling Monaco qualify for the semi-finals for the first time since 2004, David Crossan examines why their European adventure could extend all the way to Cardiff.

item.title: Buffon one step closer to elusive honour
item.description: Gianluigi Buffon has won no shortage of silverware over his stellar career but a UEFA Champions League winners' medal is conspicuous by its absence – could this finally be his year?

item.title: Champions League podcast: Final four in focus
item.description: Hear from the key men from the second legs as our panel reviews the quarter-finals and previews the last-four draw in the official UEFA Champions League podcast.

item.title: Meet this season's Champions League semi-finalists
item.description: Atlético Madrid, Juventus, Monaco and Real Madrid – allow UEFA.com to introduce this season's semi-finalists ahead of Friday's draw, which will be streamed live from 12:00CEST.

item.title: All you need to know: Champions League semi-final draw
item.description: What time is Friday's UEFA Champions League semi-final draw, how can you follow it and who's going to be involved? UEFA.com provides the full rundown.

item.title: Magical Monaco too hot for Dortmund
item.description: Kylian Mbappé and Radamel Falcao scored early goals and substitute Valère Germain struck with his first touch as Monaco beat Borussia Dortmund 3-1 on the night and 6-3 on aggregate.

item.title: Juventus frustrate Barcelona to book last-four spot
item.description: Barcelona's attempt to mount another famous comeback ran into a black-and-white wall as Juventus doggedly defended their 3-0 first-leg victory to the last.

item.title: Falcao's 45 goals in 50 games makes him Europe's best
item.description: Radamel Falcao's strike on Wednesday was his 45th in just 50 European appearances – that gives him a goals-to-games ratio of 0.90, making him the most prolific player in UEFA club competition history.

item.title: Latvia bring Starkovs back for third term
item.description: "We need to perform so that our fans can be proud of us again," said Aleksandrs Starkovs as he embarked on a third spell as Latvia coach following the departure of Marians Pahars.

item.title: Simeone's Atlético define fighting spirit
item.description: "On my first day in charge, my only hope was to make Atlético competitive and frustrate every team we played," Diego Simeone said last night. Mission accomplished, says Richard Martin.

item.title: Your guide to the 2017 UEFA Youth League finals
item.description: The fourth UEFA Youth League finals begin in Nyon, Switzerland, on Friday with Barcelona, Benfica, Real Madrid and Salzburg vying for the Lennart Johansson trophy.
